Reviews.Title: “Bijou hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Playdays
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. Like many hotels in Paris rooms were on the small side but perfectly adequate. The towels were changed every day and all the linen was beautifully clean. The bathroom seemed to have been recently refurbished and was of a very high standard. In my contact with the hotel prior to our arrival Arnaud, who is one of the receptionists, was of enormous help in recommending a decent restaurant for our first night and organising the shuttle to pick us up from CDG. Nothing was too much trouble for him. The hotel was one of the quietest I have ever stayed in both from the point of view of internal and external noise. It is on a busy street but we could hear nothing of the outside bustle. Wonderfully situated close to a large number of cafes and restaurants. We used La Liberte at the end of the street for breakfast and an occasional dinner and a lot of people watching. The Indiana bar at the other end was a good place to have a couple of beers at the end of the day as it is right by the metro exit and has happy hour from 5 - 7!! It's not mentioned in the hotel description but we did have tea and coffee making facilities. Brilliant area and a wonderful, value for money hotel with competent, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: riddlesmom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. The room was comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location was very convenient. We were able to walk to the major tourist sites when we wanted or find a nearby metro if we were tired.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SumitGupta04
Reviews.Content: Hi, I have stayed in this hotel in Sep 2010 with my partner. I booked it beacuse it was close to metro station (3 min walk). As it was my first time in Paris, I was not sure about the locations and hotel prices. This hotel has good location but the rooms are not upto the mark. The rooms were smelly, carpet was having lots of dust marks, bathroom was not having lock. Well, it is not worth for what they charge for. I would say Euro 20-30 per night is the ideal cost for the hotel like this. I would not reccomend this hotel to any couple but for single travllers, it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not clean at all”
Reviews.Author: bandcUtrecht
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. The staff was really nice, the hotelroom was pretty big and it had a great location (near Jardin du Luxembourg). But we paid €520 ( no breakfast included) and our bed had dirty sheets. And also the matrass had big stains! The bathroom door had brown/yellow stains/drops on it. In the 4 nights we've been there we didn't got new sheets. I found this to be an disappointment considering the money we paid. We've stayed in lots of hotels over the years and we have been in better hotels for less money!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great spot!”
Reviews.Author: HairyOrangutan
Reviews.Content: I`ve been on a short trip to Paris for a business meeting and a small family reunion. This small hotel is a jam for a trip when you spend most of your time outside. It has very nice "themed" rooms, each with a different wall drawing. It has nice showers, beds and courteous staff. The rooms are quite small, but I guess this is what you get coming to Paris. My parents were in a better room than me and they had some nice view from the top floor. The biggest advantage of this hotel is its location, which is simply brilliant. Two steps from a metro and railway stations and very close to the Luxemburg gardens and Montparnasse. My only two slight concerns regard the staff. First, I was required to pay when I checked in instead of the usual check-out payment - which was weird. This is not a strict hotel policy as my parents weren't required to do the same. Second, I tried to ask the front desk to book a taxi in one of the mornings... It turned out to be a busy morning for them and they simply forgot. I went down and waited for the taxi - after some time I asked them where it was and only them did they tried calling for one... It was a bit frustrating... I give this hotel a 4/5 due to its great location and overall room comfort. The staff can be a little more caring though...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great stuff, Great christmas”
Reviews.Author: henywow
Reviews.Content: The location of hotel is good, it is near a 3 metro station, u can easy reach all place of interest. near the hotel u can fond a lot of nice restaurants. staff is very helpfully. we have also a breakfast and it was !perrfect! i can only recomend it (croissant are delicious). In the shower was enought place for 2 people. Room was cleaned every day (polishing, vacuuming, clean towels, saops, ...) . This hotel helped us for have a great christmas.

Reviews.Title: “The Montparnasse was an excellent value with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sue-Z-Q2011
Reviews.Content: Great location near metro stops. Lotes of things to do and see in the area. Lots of great litytle restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: snorkellingpainter
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to Edgar Quinet metro and easily accessed from airport via RER or direct bus to Montparnesse. Can walk to Seinne through left bank areas.Good restaurants nearby, fabulous street market (mainly food) but sometimes antiques. Hotel very clean and comfortable, excellent bed. Staff very friendly and obliging. 5 Euro continental breakfast good value, includes freshly squeezed juice. Full buffet brakfast also available. Go for it... a great little hotel

Reviews.Title: “Clean, confortable, and excellent staff made us welcome”
Reviews.Author: golfball44
Reviews.Content: I would like to have tea and coffee makig facities in the room ad the bar, drink area was not in keeping with the hotel, we were made very welcome and all the reception staff, as well as the breakfast staff were excelent, Thank You.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a small package”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneEchidna
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I'd stayed in Paris and I was a bit shocked when I saw the size of the standard room. I now realise that this is what it's like in Paris. However, on my own it was okay. Having two double windows that could be opened made the room more airy and they were soundproofed so noise wasn't too much of an issue. I had friends though who stayed in a room over the street and they said it was noisy. The room had everything I needed and it was clean and recently refurbished. The staff were very pleasant and spoke English and there were many, many eating places of various nationalities nearby and as well as a great little supermarket (Monoprix). Two metro stops nearby as well. When my husband joined me after a couple of days we upgraded to a room with a little extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient spot and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Keith052
Reviews.Content: All the staff at the desk can speak english and they were very friendly and helpful. It's a convenient spot for cafes and metro service. It was my first visit to Paris and pleasant experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: parisfan50
Reviews.Content: Great location, loads of restaurants near by. Busy street but not noisy at night. Metro access great too. We all loved the beds - slept really well.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary 22 years”
Reviews.Author: Suelyabm
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel, the elevator is larger than others hotels, there are many restaurantes around, metro is so close.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: le_sloth
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and very friendly hotel in Montparnasse. Surprisingly quiet seeing as it's in a busy touristy area.  Rooms seemed to have been recently refurbished, each one having a mural of a famous work of art. Good aircon; windows open onto road. Adjoining rooms available if you need them.  Bathrooms are very nice, but if I had to criticise one thing it would be a lack of anywhere to hang a towel!  Plenty of freebies during your stay including wifi (everywhere, but not too reliable), guidebooks in several languages, umbrellas, safes and even free phone calls (bizarrely!).  Breakfast was an extra €9 pp and to be honest wasn't up to much - you might be better off finding a coffee and croissant elsewhere.  Lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance, but most were a bit too touristy. A few theatres nearby too, as well as the excellent Marché Raspail and Jardin du Luxembourg.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, no fuss hotel with comfortable bed and hot shower”
Reviews.Author: RossB49
Reviews.Content: Convenient to metro and Gare Montparnasse (for trains heading West and South-West). Cosy room, but big enough; well appointed (decent sized TV, free wireless internet, phone with Skype-type rates). Lots of bars, restaurants and shops in walking distance. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: TooHardtoPickaName
Reviews.Content: The air conditioning was wonderful and the room quality and cleanliness are excellent. The only negative was that the rooms are relatively noisy as they have thin walls and thin doors. Also, the free internet connection is a little unpredictable and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money”
Reviews.Author: Success26
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been completely rennovated and each room with a theme based on a famours painter. Most of the rooms are quiet, the air conditioning works well. All rooms are I believe relatively small but very tastefully decorated and impeccably clean. I have never stayed in a better hotel in Paris for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Better than a 4 star hotel - a fabulous base from which to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Daisydee1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful little oasis in the busy and interesting Montparnasse area. Less than a minute away from Edgar Quinet metro and five minutes from three other metro lines it is right in the heart of a Montparnasse with little cafes and restaurants lined up one after the other. The hotel is spotlessly clean with comfortable beds, wonderful air conditioning and what looked like a brand new bathroom with a big shower. We stayed on seventh floor - room 702 with single twin beds (elevator works efficiently) and because of good air conditioning did not have to open the windows and therefore heard no noise from the busy area at night when were in our room. Such friendly, helpful staff who were also very professional made sure that my friend and I enjoyed a brilliant 5 night stay. Two minutes away from the Montparnasse Tower - 11 euros to travel the 56 floors in the elevator which takes you up to the most wonderful 360 panoramic view of the hotel. The Eiffel Tower is a pleasant twenty five minute walk down to the river Seine and you cant get lost with the Tower always in view as you walk towards it. Get a book of 12 metro tickets for 12.50 euros which is cheaper than buying them one by one at 1.60 euros. Take the 'CAR Rouge' open topped double decker red bus which you can get on at the Eiffel Tower. 24 euros for a two day pass which you can use to get on and off the 10 stops as many times as you like. They even provide a set of earphones you can plug into the wall of the bus up or down stairs to hear about the sites around the centre of the city. Take the metro to Monmartre and visit Sacre Coeur (lovely clean and cheap little cafe just at the front of it and the views over the city are amazing) Whilst you are there make sure you find the Place de Teurtre which is the quaint square filled with cafes and restaurants and also very talented artists who will draw your portrait for you at a negotiated price. - Go to dinner at Jim Haynes house on Sunday evening - near Alicia Metro stop He has a website where you can make a reservation. My friend and I went and met some facinating people from all over the world. Amazing trip and will definitely visit Paris and stay in this hotel for all future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money but in a strange neighbourhood...”
Reviews.Author: muratie
Reviews.Content: We had decent stay at the Hotel Elysee Montparnasse. It is close to several underground stations and there are plenty of bars and restaurants near the hotel. The rooms were good value for money although the walls seemed pretty thin. Although the hotel is good value for money (especially for Paris) the area around the hotel is a bit dodgy and the breakfast is average at best. We might return in the future for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: olivia18_10
Reviews.Content: The room was great, very clean and lovely décor (looked exactly how it was shown on the website). Breakfast is worth the 9 Euros (great variety and abundance). The area is fine, a few things to visit around the hotel but it's easy to just take a metro to the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good service & location”
Reviews.Author: Julie32655
Reviews.Content: room was little small but cleaned. nice location. staffs were very kind. we will stay again when i go in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: sage_8
Reviews.Content: I don't think this hotel ranks 3 stars or the price. Everything was dated and a little funky, room was tiny even by European standards. We stayed there based on TA ratings and because we needed hotel near the Gare Montparnasse (it is in easy walking distance), but would much prefer to be in the Latin quarter, St. Germain, or the Marais. The worst thing -- the very modern glass shower had no flashing or seal at the bottom - so every shower literally flooded the whole bathroom. The best thing -- market day on Saturday morning just down the street. Also -- the staff was very nice, helpful, and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: FloChina
Reviews.Content: the location is excellent, less than 5 minutes' walk to the metro station (Edgar Quinet line 6) and 10 mins to Gare Montparnass, quite a few restaurants and bars near the hotel, the surrounding area is safe. Room size is small but well equipped, breadfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “good location less then a block from the metro gaite station”
Reviews.Author: cadusis
Reviews.Content: the rooms were clean and new and the staff was helpful and understanding . the only thing i can find falt with is the scary clown painting in the elevator. it was near a lot of great resturants

Reviews.Title: “nice, friendly, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: citytravel1
Reviews.Content: stayed for 1 night, location is nice if you do not mind some nightlife in the neighbourhood, nice restaurants nearby. Got a room to the back, which was nice and quiet. Each room decorated after a different painter - creates nice athmosphere. Breakfast in the basement, but much better than other Paris hotels. Free WiFi Overall very positive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ideal for a short break”
Reviews.Author: gastkt
Reviews.Content: Location was good for metro, hotel is a nice 3 star hotel, spotlessly clean with helpful staff. Rooms are small enough but for a short stay this is not really a problem. The hotel does not really have a bar as such and we did not eat in the hotel but there are plenty of cafe's and restaurants nearby! If on a budget this is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean hotel with a bit small room”
Reviews.Author: bilariba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect neighborhood, full of cafes and restaurants, full of life, but very quiet inside the room. It is also located in just 3min. walk from nearest metro station. Room was VERY clean and had great decoration, but was small. Staff was very friendly. Overall a great good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice weekend in Paris. Good location...”
Reviews.Author: ullcosta
Reviews.Content: A nice weekend in Paris. Good location. Room 605 was acceptable and was cleaned every day. Quite small but I guess that's Paris. The breakfast is too expensive, around there are Beautiful cafes cheaper and with more charm and natural light. Good value for money but don't think to come on a honey moon

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, good location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Muschamp00
Reviews.Content: A small room (the norm in Paris), but well decorated with ensuite and balcony. Very clean. Very good value for money. Wonderful staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would return. Gail Muschamp

Reviews.Title: “top choice for 2 reasons: staff courtesy and location”
Reviews.Author: PhilnParis
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Paris, and by far the best. Having stayed in 5 star hotels previously, I booked this hotel based on Tripadvisor recommendations as far as proximity to Gare Montparnasse ( for our Lourdes trip) and value for money. Our experience was beyond expectations, from the moment we checked in to check out. Location was the best, with restaurants all over, especially oriental food which we liked very much, then proximity to 2 metro stops, and supermarket. The assistance we got from the staff was top notch, and it made a lot of difference in rating this hotel as excellent. Thank you Trip advisor and Congratulations to Hotel Elysee Montparnasse.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull, Small, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Bbobby
Reviews.Content: Rooms are smaller than expected. Good localization for concert, japanese food and tourism.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a great rate in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Coco147
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice in the last year and enjoyed both my stays. The rooms and bathrooms are well decorated and the staff couldn't be any more helpful. Considering most hotels in Paris have very small rooms I though the rooms here weren't too bad. They’ve made the most of the space.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonRoyston
Reviews.Content: I would happily recommend this hotel. We stayed for a few nights over NYE, one double and one twin. The rooms are not very large, but are acceptable. Our rooms were spotless and the shower was fantastic. The staff at receiption were always very polite, friendly and very heplful. Also this hotel is in a really cool location - loads of theatres and bars, yes there is also a few adult shops, but you don't have to go in and they don't lower the tone of the area. This hotel is also close to 3 Metro stations, one takes you to the eiffel tower and the Arc de Triomphe. The other one takes you to Gare du Nord (Eurostar)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel in Lively Location”
Reviews.Author: almajosgan100
Reviews.Content: 3 couples stayed here for 4 days late Sept and loved it,It is situated between 3 metro Stations mins walk away from the montparnasse tower,We took the RER B train in from CDG and only had to chage metro station once,Easy access to al lthe sights from these 3 metros and all within 2-6 mins walking distance.The area full of restaurants, bars and a market on Sat moring.There is also a large shopping mall beside metro Bienvenue Montparnasse with C&A ,Zara etc. Staff were very friendly, spoke good English,the lady who served breakfast was very warm and welcoming and if you early then there is lots of food for breakfast both hot and cold all you can eat service.It was 9 euro per breakfast Couple of doors up there was cafe on the corner that served full filled Omelette, fresh bread and tea/coffee for 7-50 euro. Rooms are on small side (as per the norm in Paris) but very clean,2 of the couples had a little apartif waiting in their rooms for them.. I would recommend this hotel for couples,young and old, The weekend nights the streets are lively till the early hours as lot of bars/restaurants and theatres on this street. There are several ''Adult' shops on the street but it is all very discreet so it didnt offend us at all, I would say to shop around on different websites for good deals for this hotel,I was amazed at the difference in price on several websites, Its a good 3 star hotel,in fact there is a 4star across the road called the ABBA(I think!) and one evening 2 guests from there came over to book in as they were disgusted at money paid for service and rooms they were getting. Will def return when back in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lcOcOl
Reviews.Content: Very good location. If you are going to take Les Cars Air France from the airport to hotel, the stop is just 10 minute walk from the hotel. Two metro stations very close by. One main station which is a little further but still within walking distance (approx.10 mins) and you can access to metro and RER there. A lot of restaurants and café. Some mini markets and a supermarket too. A McDonald in the area too. The rooms are neat, clean, and pretty new, just a little small. Free wi-fi works in both of my rooms. A/C are working. Sound-proof windows. Bathrooms are reasonable size. Nice shower with hot water. Staff are friendly. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: kubata
Reviews.Content: I'm European and I'm used to small rooms but this hotel surprised me. I even booked the 'club room' thinking about having some extra space (there were two of us) and the room was really small. We couldn't have both suitcases open at the same time. The staff was the best part. They were very helpful although they didn't resolved our problem with the wi-fii until the very last day (we stayed there 7 nights). The location is convenient since it's just a block from one of the main train stations. Many restaurants around the hotel and it felt safe. It wasn't too bad for a business trip but I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic trip. Everything is so expensive in Paris that I guess the price was all right. I probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous bargain hotel among cafe community”
Reviews.Author: Ambiverbal
Reviews.Content: This place was a hidden gem. The decor was vibrant, the rooms small but sparkling, the desk attendants extremely courteous, the breakfast sumptuous, and the neighborhood colorful and entertaining. The air-conditioning worked well, the water was hot for the shower, towels were thirsty and plentiful, and although the room was small, it was more than enough for a couple of platonic friends traveling together. Free wifi worked well for me, although a traveling companion had trouble gaining reception in his room on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “For the Montparnasse section of Paris, this hotel is a very good choice.”
Reviews.Author: baldy35
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect location for an overnight stay with a departure the next morning from the Gare Montparnasee. The room was clean, pleasant and average size for 3 star hotels in Paris. The front desk staff was knowledgeable, courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Went last year as well, would go again.”
Reviews.Author: Paz48
Reviews.Content: Good location for metro,food and sights. Hotel very well presented,clean comfortable and very helpful staff ... breakfast may get busy but worth waiting for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, nice location, comfortable room - perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: JulesFRA
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I stayed there for 6 nights and were really pleased with our choice. The staff is very friendly and helpful; one of them even speaks German and I guess most of them English. We liked the location in Montparnasse because it's not THAT touristy like in Montmartre, but there are still plenty of cafes and restaurants in the same street. Also you have 3 metro stations within a 3-5 minute walk radius. If you arrive by train at Gare du Nord, there's a direct line to theMontparnasse-Bienvenue station. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated and we even got a room with 2 separate beds as we asked for. They were not that spacious, but ok. The bathroom was quite modern and very nice. Of course you hear a little noise from the cafes and restaurants in the street (more on the weekend, not so much during the week) but - hey you are in the center of Paris not in the countryside! Don't be disturbed by the erotic stores in the street - they are almost everywhere in the cities nowadays, and the area arount the hotel is definitely NOT a red light district, but a wonderful neighborhood. Breakfast is good for French measures - they served baguette and different types of croissants and brioche and besides jam also cheese, ham, scambled eggs.... after 6 days it gets a little boring but ok. We had a great time there and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, charming hotel in relaxed and great surrounding”
Reviews.Author: Leoline
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the hotel - in a (though small) very clean, beautifully decorated room! The pictures on the internet do not promise to much. We especially enjoyed the wonderfull surroundings - with market on Saturday, flee market on Sunday and many little crepe-restaurants around! Breakfast was very rich - though it is a great service to be able to have breakfast until 10:45: Better avoid coming after 10 o'clock because then there are unfortunately not enough tables available, if the hotel is full! Nevertheless - we would always return to the hotel, given the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: KimGN
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Elysée Montparnasse in a so-called business room, and I was reasonably impressed by the value for money. There is free wifi and air-condition and even a bath robe, which I became fund of. The breakfast is among the best I have tried in Paris, but it doesn't say much, neither that the room is also among the largest. I had to re-arrange the furniture (move the bed even!) in order to sit in the chair and watch the nice flat-panel TV, and there was a lack of electric outlets: only one that was on when the ceiling chandelier was not on. The neighborhood is a little bit sleazy with a handful of sex-shops in the street, but also 7 theatres and several bars and restaurants that are open late. It is right next to Gare Montparnasse. Don't miss to go to the Tour Montparnasse for the view at night. The closest Metro is Edgar Quinet, 50 meters away. The service was excellent, and I certainly has this hotel on my short-list the next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: rustylwb
Reviews.Content: Over the year's we have stayed at over 10 hotel's within a few blocks of this hotel. Without question this is the best hotel value we have found the hotel is newly renovated and the location is excellent. It is on rue de la Gaite a short street in Montparnasse with 3 metro stops within minutes of the hotel. The stop's include the Air France Bus stop at Gare Montparnasse for CDG. The Gaite Mall is only 2 block's away as well as the Galleries Lafayette, there are 2 major grocery stores in the area and every kind of restaurant's. The hotel has free WiFi in the rooms and a free computer in the lobby. The breakfast was included in our price and included the usual bread's, chesse, coffee and juice also eggs, sausage and ham. A very nice breakfast. We had a room in the back if you like it quite try the back room's as gaite has a lot of foot traffic on weekend's. The room had a flat screen TV with 2 english station's but not BBC. We had a Club Room and the cost was 130 euro's including breakfast. We do a lot of looking before we book our hotel's and there are not any hotel's of this quality in this area for this price. I have included some picture's taken from the room. Happy Traveling Rusty

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigoudi1
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, easy access to Montparnasse station, close to metro stations, close to St.Germain. The Elysee rooms are a little bit small, but very elegant and clean. The staff is very helpfull and kind. It is a very good value hotel, I definitely recommend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tinanessa
Reviews.Content: nice rooms with a nice big picture bathtub in a 3 person-room lift nearly every day new towels breakfast with croissants, bread, cheese, cold meat, scrambled eggs, marmelade, honey, nutella, kellogs, apple puree, fruits, fresh juices, coffee, tea at night not quiet, but not to much noise good position to start sightseeing restaurants, supermarkets, shops very near at the hotel more than one metro station near at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in busy area and easy to get to with the Metro”
Reviews.Author: and1Belfast
Reviews.Content: Would recommend staying above first floor as the street can be a bit noisy first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “good value, quiet small rooms, newly renovated and fresh”
Reviews.Author: hepuckster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at here because it was close to the Montparnasse train station. My daughter and I trained in from Bergerac. Hotel is in easy walking distance and it was newly renovated, so it was a good choice for us

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bukka
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, convenient, well-kept, nice staff. only minor complaint was the street noise in the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel an excellent value when booked using internet special rate.”
Reviews.Author: SLois
Reviews.Content: My partner and I returned today from a 4-night stay booked for approximately 100 Euros per night from the hotel website. This was a minimum 3-night stay package that included a lovely breakfast buffet. The Hotel Elysee Montparnasse was more similar to a B&B than it was to the usual hotels that we frequent in the U.S. The room was small, providing minimal storage, but charming with the headwall art and working balcony windows overlooking the street. We moved to this hotel after I worked for a week in a suburban Paris area. We found its location to be convenient to explore a variety of Paris neighborhoods by foot and Metro. A wide variety of restaurants were nearby, as well as a couple of supermarkets. Soundproofing was suboptimal, with noise from the elevator door, neighboring rooms, and the street. Wireless internet was not working in the rooms, but we were able to use the computer workstation provided for guests. We did have a minor problem with leakage into our bathroom ceiling from the plumbing above. The staff did their best to understand our description of the problem and try to address it. Will definitely try to stay here again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: APoulain
Reviews.Content: Small rooms but well furnished and clean Very friendly staff - nice breakfirst.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Hotel Elysee”
Reviews.Author: roamingcabincrew
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location turned out to be excellent because we were just a few blocks from one of the two air france bus stops, which provide transportation to the airport. We were also just a few blocks away from a metro station (Gaite). (easy access to Champs Elysee and Eiffel Tower). We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cute - Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Embonbon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i recently visited Paris for several days and couldn't be happier with our stay at the Hotel Elysee Montparnasse. The room was very small (as was expected), but was very nice and had a view of the city (with Sacre Coeur in the distance). The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent english (in response to my sad attempts at french). They helped us find our way to Versailles and gave great dinner recommendations. The area was filled with creperies and other delicious restaurants. Other reviews mention 'adult' shops on the street, but was just a few places and def wasn't an issue. Can't wait to book our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A very good deal deal”
Reviews.Author: andvaranaut
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay in this hotel owing to a friend's recommendation and I was very pleased with it. The room was very nice (albeit somewhat small), with a well-equipped bathroom and a good bed. The staff was friendly and helpful, breakfast was plentiful and delicious (by French standards), and the price was excellent. It is right by two Metro stations and by Gare Montparnasse, ensuring fast access to most parts of the city. In fact, there are shuttle buses (the Cars Air France) which get you from Orly or CDG directly to the Gare - very convenient. They are a bit more expensive than riding the RER and the Metro, but they are faster (the Orly one at least) and will save you a few transfers dragging your bags. The location is reasonable - it is within walking distance of all sights in Montparnasse (mostly the Tour Montparnasse and the cemetery - don't miss the view from the Tower at dusk!), as well as the Jardins du Luxembourg. Other famous sights are relatively far, although the Metro gets you everywhere. The worst case for city sights is probably Montmartre, which is about half an hour away by Métro (and is not exactly centric anyway). It is perfectly reasonable to take the Metro in the morning, walk until you are exhausted and then get back to the hotel. My only gripe with my stay is that they offer you a package in which, for a surcharge, they give you a Mobilis card (a 1-day travel pass) per person. It looked like a nice deal, so I signed up for it. Well, although the surcharge is applied every night, only one card per person is given for the whole stay. If you are staying one or two nights (double room) it is a reasonable deal; if not, you'll be ripped off (not by much, but ripped off nonetheless). I am specially annoyed by the fact that I asked whether that was the case beforehand several times, but they didn't answer my question - fishy! But don't let that distract you. Unless you are lucky enough to find a very nice hotel in a location closer to the centre (for a competitive price and with a great breakfast buffet to boot), this is probably one of the best deals available in Paris accommodations. I would repeat in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A great resting place!”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel4
Reviews.Content: A very friendly staff. New bathrooms, small but exceptionally clean rooms. A short walk to the metro on a street with many cafes. I'll definitely be recommending the Elysee Montparnasse to my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcdavit
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but very clean. You do not want to be on street level if street noise bothers you. We loved looking out the window at all the activity. Everyone on the staff was terrific. The breakfast in the morning was great. We would definately stay again. The Monparnasse area is very artsy. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for money”
Reviews.Author: themagiclake
Reviews.Content: Great location, room and staff, hotel is very close to metro 6, Quinet, lot of bistrot, cafè and restaurant, the best value for money. Will come back for sure next time I'll travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel on Montparnasse”
Reviews.Author: Quasimodificator
Reviews.Content: Hi all. It was a pleasant 8 days stay at Elysee Montparnasse in August 2008. It's clean, personnel is nice, they've got wonderful pictures with clowns on the walls and in the elevator. Breakfast is alright for first days, but then it starts to get boring as it's all the same all the time. They should change cheeses/yogurts/meats from day to day, at least. I think also that it's better to stay closer to the center, as montparnasse now is nice, but not quite as it was a century ago I guess. And Paris metro is absolutely awful. We rented a bike from a rental agency (you need a chip visa card for renting Velib bikes, otherwise it aint working) and our travel became much more fun than via metro system. The room is small but it has everything needed. I stayed at 5* ultra all inclusive hotel in Turkey in September 2008, and it had all the same stuff inside the room. So if you dont We also couldn't use wifi though we had two wifi devices. We didnt spend much time on making that work, as they have a computer with internet at the reception, it's free, but sometimes other clients are using it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jahamh
Reviews.Content: Good position on the Rue de la Gaite. The atmosphere of the area is bohemian as befits the theatre district and whilst has an adult element, is focused on fun - restaurants galore!. Hotel is good for business and pleasure - good modern facilities in a more classically styled environment. Rooms are a good size for inner-city and well-appointed. Can recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A real charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarce
Reviews.Content: Despite the small room size, everything seems to be brand new, in a cozy environment. LCD TV, fine beds and wallpainings make this a charming hotel. Street plenty of nice bistrots and close to a well known night club. Gisele Fleury Charmillot Lemos, Sao Paulo, Brazil

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: DianeOttawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 12 year old son in a twin bed room on the 7th floor. Very sound proofed (music festival on June 21, music in the streets till very late did not hear a thing). clean, modern, recently upgraded. Very close to two metro stops and train station therefore convient for transportation. Buffet breakfast very good. You have to ask for eggs though. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but very noisey”
Reviews.Author: Tashco42
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend in Paris @ the Elysee Montparnasse hotel and had a rather average experience. The rooms & hotel in general are lovely, clean, newly refurbished however there are several things that made the whole stay uncomfortable. The rooms have extremely thin walls and all sounds from other rooms / within the hotel is heard very loud and clear!! The hotel is on a fairly busy (socially) road so at night it is impossible to fall asleep. Bought myself some ear plugs to make it through the loudness. I found the waitress in the breakfast area to be rather rude and extremely non hospitable. It's probably best to have breakfast at a nearby cafe ... you'll get more for your 12 euros there. The location of the the hotel is good and access to the metro is great as its at the end of the road. All in all it was just OK for me

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RT1102
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec 2006 and as the reviews previously said it was quite run down. We booked again, purely because of the location and decided to rough it with the hotel. Its in the middle of a refurb and is excellent. Clean and the staff are extremely helpful. Would use again without a doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, rude staff, rubbish breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Lillabeff
Reviews.Content: Awful. Renovations going on in corridor and rooms beside ours (which was TINY but nicely furnished, was a renovated room). Woken very early each morning by drills and hammers. When complaining I did so in French and didn't understand receptionist's answer, to which he asked very snottily "Do you speak French or not?" So rude. Was shown an alternative unrenovated room and let me tell you this much, I just felt sorry for anyone staying in one of those. It was atrocious. Really was like something from Psycho or Hostel. Breakfast (bread and tea or coffee, costs 8 euro by the way if not included) served in a disused bedroom, tiny with wired and fittings hanging out of wall. Loads of porn shops everywhere, NOT RECOMMENDED FOR FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN. Just glad that we were out sightseeing and didn't have to spend too much time there,only to sleep which was nearly impossible due to street noise at night and drilling and hammering right outside our door every morning. STAY HERE AT YOUR PERIL!!! PS Don't know how that photo of reception was taken, it's so tiny, it's just a cheap trick.

Reviews.Title: “Should Be Condemned”
Reviews.Author: dhtravel
Reviews.Content: I recently booked this hotel and was extremely disatisfied. The hotel is situated on a side street with adult porn shops-one being right across the alley so the "L'Erotique" purple neon sign could be seen from your room as well. There was no mention that the hotel was under renovation/construction. There were electrical wires hanging from the walls in the hallways directly proceeding to my room-some of which were live due to the light bulbs swinging from them that were lit. The only elevator in use was one from the early 1900's and was literally 2 feet by 3 feet. The other elevator was under construction and as I exited my room I could peer through gaps on each side of the elevator doors down 4 stories in the elevator shaft. Note that there was no sign indicating that the elevator was not in use or safe to be in the vicinity of. The hotel was extrememly dusty from the renovation with white dust covering almost everything in the hallway. There were cracks and paint peeling from the walls with trim missing. In our room there were cracks in the bathroom ventilation and the room's heating and cooling vents had no covers on them so we could see right into the ceiling. The breakfast room also had electrical sockets exposed with an expensive breakfast considering you only got croissants and coffee. We canceled our reservation that next day even with a penalty. When I asked the clerk for help he told me that they were unable to do anything and I would have to contact the online reservation entity I used.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: johnnee
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a good area of Paris, close to all Paris attractions and also close to transportations: trains station, metro station, airports shuttles. It is a nice and cosy place to stay when visiting Paris if you don’t want to spend a lot on a room. The personnel were very nice and they speak very good English. The access to the rooms can be done by stairs and/or elevator. The tiny elevator says it can carry up to 3 persons but there has to be 3 very thin ones. Even so, it is good enough for 2 and if you kiss your partner less you’ll be temped to do it there *smile*. The room was small but good enough for 2. Our room had a bath with bath tub also. They’ve changed the towels and clean the room every day of stay there. Every room has a safe to store your values and it is already included in the price of the room. They have free Wifi internet in the lobby but we were able to use it only in our first day. But you can find a free spot in the street also. We did just around the corner. There were renovating the hotel during our stay: part of the lobby, the restaurant, and the first floor but even so the part that the clients were accessing was clean. The rooms are not soundproofed so you can hear from next room or when they use the showers because the walls are thin. If you usually live in a block of apartments you’ll be used to it. If you intend to rent an apartment in Paris you’ll have the same problem with the sound. Most of the apartments in Paris have thin walls between the rooms. As a conclusion, I recommend this hotel for its good quality/price rate and especially for young couples or singles and for budget families. I decided to write the review because I read very hard reviews before and I got very scared at the hotel thinking it is going to be a [--] our stay. I have attached some photos so others can see what I am talking about.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Elysee Montparnasse
HotelInfo.Address: 11 bis rue de la Gaite | 14 Arr., 75014 Paris, France
